items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

By law the Board of Trustees is required to place a notice in the local newspaper that the District will be presenting a budget to the Board of Trustees for adoption at its September 11, 2012 meeting and that the public may comment on the budget. Notice was posted in the San Jose Mercury News on Saturday, August 25, 2012, and the budget was made available to the public for inspection Tuesday, September 4, 2012.
	 
This item is intended to identify the place in the agenda where the public may comment on the proposed adopted budget.

items.item_details:
In 2001 AB 540 (Firebaugh-Nonresident Students Act) created the first state-authorized exemption from non-resident tuition at public postsecondary institutions for nonresident/undocumented students.  Ten years later two additional bills were enacted into law AB 130 (July 2011) and AB 131 (October 2011).  These two bills now constitute the California Dream Act extending benefits of private and state funded financial aid to postsecondary students that met the criteria established in  AB 540 as follows:
Attended a CA high school for 3+ years
Graduated from a CA high school or the equivalent
Enrolled in an accredited CA college or university
Submitted an affidavit with postsecondary institution stating that he/she has filed an application to legalize status or will file as soon as eligible.
Diana Fuentes-Michel, Executive Director, California Student Aid Commission, will provide background on the implementation of the California Dream Act and her commitment to work closely with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District representatives to facilitate implementation of the Act now slated for January, 2013.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees.  District Policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval.  All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (current bid limit is $81,000) should have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of July 10, 2012 through August 9, 2012 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
Since 2000, the Workforce Institute has contracted with the City of San Jose (work2future) to provide job readiness workshops to Santa Clara County job seekers. Workforce Institute has delivered over 24,450 hours of job readiness workshops at multiple locations in Campbell, Gilroy and San Jose and online training to over 1,694 job seekers in an effort to equip them with the skills they need to market themselves in this tight economic market.
 
For program year 2012-2013, work2future has included Workforce Institute in its WIA Workshop Provider List and has awarded WI a NTE contract of $600,000 to provide instructor led workshops, online training, and WorkKeys sessions.  Actual revenue earned through the WIA Workshop Provider List is predicated on clients choosing WI courses from a menu of workshops offered via multiple providers.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the 2012-2013 WIA Workshops Contract.
items.item_text: Workforce Institute - WIA work2future Workshop Contract

items.item_details: Oral reports will be given by members of the Board of Trustees.
Oral reports will be given by Chancellor Rita Cepeda.
Oral reports will be given by the college presidents.
Oral reports will be given by the constituency representatives.

Shared (District) Accreditation Recommendation #5 (Board Governance) found that "In order to meet the standards, the team recommends the Board of Trustees systematically review and revise the board policy manual to ensure that policies are up-to-date.  To be included in this process, should be a robust ethics policy that establishes steps to be taken should a board member violate the policy.  The policy update should include the development of a policy on evaluation of the college presidents."  
	 
In response to the Accreditation Commission's concern regarding systematic review and revision of Board policy, much progress has been made.  First, the policy manual was reviewed and updated.  The Board of Trustees then reviewed and concurred with the process (attached) by which board policies would be reviewed/recommended for approval.  As part of this process, a management tool was identified to more effectively monitor and work on policy revision, which assisted in the monitoring and management of board policies and timelines.  With the approval of Board Policy Chapter 5 (Student Services) at the August 14, 2012 Board of Trustees meeting, the District achieved the lofty goal of reviewing and revising 20% of it's board policies.  
	 
Attached is the Flow Chart for formal approval by the Board as well as two supporting documents as evidence of work completed by District Council.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees formally approve the board policy process to review board policies on a regular basis.
items.item_text: Formal Action to Approve Board Policy Review Process

items.item_details:
ADOPTION OF THE FISCAL YEAR 2012/2013 BUDGET
	 
The San Jose/Evergreen Community College District proposed Adopted Budget for Fiscal Year 2012/2013 is included as part of this item.  The California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office requires the District's Board of Trustees to approve the adopted budget by September 17, 2012.
	 
This Budget for Fiscal Year 2012/2013 complies with the 7% Reserve Policy established by the Board of Trustees in February 2011, assumes that the Tax Initiative passes, poses an approximate $700,000 growth/restoration loss, and $400,000 workload reduction risk if it fails, and as presented projects an ending fund balance of $6.8 million representing 8.9% of total expenditures.
	 
The District Budget Committee reviewed this budget and has accepted the underlying budget assumptions, including the major assumption that the State Tax Measure will pass, preserving the District's apportionment base and generating 1.11% in additional FTES growth funding totaling $700,000.
	 
	 
The Adopted Budget is provided as an attachment to this item and also can be accessed on the District's web site at 
http://www.sjeccd.edu/business/AdminServices/Pages/BudgetReports.aspx.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt the Fiscal Year 2012-2013 budget as presented.

items.item_details:
ACCEPT AS INFORMATION ITEMS 
Project Highlights 
None 
	 
Monthly Measure G-2010 Summary Report through August 31, 2012 
Attached please find the Measure G-2010 Summary Report through August 31, 2012.
	 
APPROVE AS ACTION ITEMS 
Contracts
	 
Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) – Underwood & Rosenblum - EVC Topographic Surveying Services
	 
In order to support the various design activities that will be occurring at Evergreen Valley College it is necessary to have a comprehensive topographic map of the campus.  None currently exists.  In response to a supplemental RFQ issued to the identified shortlist of surveying firms approved by the Board on August 7, 2012, four firms provided specific information related to their experience, approach, schedule and rates to topographic survey at EVC.  Review by District, EVC and Gilbane staff identified Underwood & Rosenblum as the most qualified to perform this task.
	 
The Board is asked to approve issuance of a Project Assignment Agreement to Underwood & Rosenblum in the amount of $99,000 for topographic survey services at Evergreen Valley College.
	 
Purchase Agreement – Portable Facilities Leasing – EVC Police and Gilbane offices
	 
To support the Measure G-2004 bond projects, a lease agreement was approved by the Board in September, 2009 with Portable Facilities Leasing to provide portable buildings for use as classrooms, offices and to support fitness activities.  With the termination of these leases in July 2012 Evergreen Valley College desires to retain certain of those buildings for use as 1) interim housing of the Police Department during the construction of the new Police Station adjacent to the Central Plant building at EVC, and 2) for construction management offices for the Measure G-2010 program manager, Gilbane Building Company.  The college evaluated lease cost versus purchase and determined that purchase is the most cost-effective approach for these units.  An analysis is attached.
	 
The Board is asked to approve issuance of a Purchase Agreement to Portable Facilities Leasing in the amount of $186,700 for purchase of portable buildings for Police interim housing and Measure G-2010 construction management offices at Evergreen Valley College.
	 
Lease Agreement – Portable Facilities Leasing – EVC Fitness Portable Buildings
	 
To support the Measure G-2004 bond projects, a lease agreement was approved by the Board in September, 2009 with Portable Facilities Leasing to provide portable buildings for use as classrooms, offices and to support fitness activities.  With the termination of these leases in July 2012 Evergreen Valley College desires to retain certain of those buildings for use as fitness and weight room facilities until the new Fitness Center is completed.  The college evaluated lease cost versus purchase, location and final disposition of these units.  EVC determined that lease of these units is the most appropriate approach.  An analysis is attached.
	 
The Board is asked to approve issuance of a Lease Agreement to Portable Facilities Leasing in the amount of $72,000 for portable buildings for fitness and weight room use per the terms of the attached agreement at Evergreen Valley College.
	 
Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) – Sandis Engineering for SJCC Campus Water System Mapping & Consolidation Project
	 
The domestic water supply infrastructure at San Jose City College is not well mapped and does not currently allow separate facilities to be isolated to implement routine and scheduled maintenance resulting in the need to shut down large portions of the campus for minor repairs.  Sandis Engineering was selected from the previously approved shortlist of MEP firms to provide investigation, assessment and recommendations for the scope of work necessary to improve to the system to support much needed ongoing design and maintenance efforts.  Once the scope of work is defined, design and construction administration services will be solicited to move the project forward.
	 
The Board is asked to approve issuance of a Project Assignment Agreement (PAA) to Sandis Engineering in the amount of $59,500 for the SJCC Campus Water System Mapping and Consolidation Project.
	 
Vehicle Replacement
	 
The Measure G-2010 bond includes a project to replace aging and non-functioning vehicles.  As part of this project the District solicited bids for certain vehicle needs deemed immediately necessary.
	 
In August, 2012, Bid Proposal #G2010.0024 – Vehicles Replacement, Group 2 Trucks and Vans was advertised for the replacement of aging vehicles for the continued operation of the District.  A spreadsheet analyzing the bids is attached.
	 
The Board of Trustees is asked to approve purchase of the vehicles listed for Vehicles Replacement, Group 2 – Trucks and Vans in the amounts listed in the attachment.
	 
	 
Contract Revisions and Changes 
None
	 
	 
Bond List Revisions 
None

items.item_details: The Board and Chancellor are agendized to meet in closed session to complete the 2011-2012 evaluation.  In the event that the Board and Chancellor discussion addresses anything related to terms of the contract, action to modify the contract must occur in open session. This Action Item is placed on the Agenda to give the Board the ability to modify the terms of the contract consistent with the finalization of the evaluation process.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees vote to approve any modifications of the Chancellor's contract.

items.item_details: Dr. Mike Russell, CampusWorks CISO, will provide a Technology update.
Chancellor Rita Cepeda will provide a Legislative update.

The Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (ACCJC,) at its meeting on January 11-13, 2011, reviewed the Evergreen Valley College's (EVC) and San Jose City College's (SJCC) Institutional Self Study Reports and the reports of the evaluation teams that visited the colleges in October 2010. The Commission acted to issue a Warning to EVC and Probation to SJCC and asked the colleges to address every recommendation, correct the deficiencies and resolve the issues identified in the Commission's letters of January 31, 2011. The colleges are required to submit their Follow-Up Reports to the ACCJC by October 15, 2012. The attached reports are being presented to the Board for a first reading and will be submitted for approval at the October 9, 2012, Governing Board Meeting. EVC President Henry Yong and SJCC President Barbara Kavalier will provide an overview of their college's reports.
items.item_text: EVC and SJCC Accreditation Reports - First Reading
items.item_text_raw: 3. EVC and SJCC Accreditation Reports - First Reading

items.item_details:
At the August 14, 2012, Board of Trustees’ Meeting, Chancellor Rita Cepeda and Milpitas Unified School District Superintendent Cary Matsuoka presented an update on the progress made toward the establishment of a Joint-Use Educational Services Center in Milpitas. 
	 
The next step in the effort was the development of a draft Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to Develop a Joint-Use 21st Century Education Center.  The initial draft of this MOU is being presented for review and consideration.  The MUSD Board of Trustees is also receiving this draft at its September Board meeting.  It is expected that this MOU will be brought for action on October 9, 2012.  Subsequent to the approval by both boards, a joint signing ceremony will be scheduled in November.
items.item_text: Milpitas Unified School District/San Jose Evergreen CCD Joint Education Services Center Draft Memorandum of Understanding
